oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interstate 7 Show - Loretta Lynn and Ernest Ray interview - Jack Reno - 1978 - WLW - part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of a segment of the Interstate 7 Show with Jack Reno (host), featuring Loretta Lynn (performer) and Ernest Ray Lynn (performer), broadcast in 1978 on radio station WLW (Cincinnati, Ohio).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening statement ([Unidentified]) -- Opening theme -- (00:53) Jack Reno introduces Loretta Lynn -- (01:05) Loretta talks about going to a baseball game in Cincinnati and how cold it was -- (01:55) Loretta talks about playing a show in town and other venues in Ohio -- (02:15) Loretta talks about her son Ernest appearing on a television show in town -- (02:40) Loretta talks about visiting the White House the previous week -- (03:00) Loretta talks about appearing on the Muppets television show in England -- (05:30) Loretta talks about the producer of the Muppets -- (06:49) Loretta talks about picking new songs for an album with Conway Twitty which they recently finished recording -- (08:30) Loretta talks about a new solo single releasing soon -- (09:40) Loretta talks about her recording "Spring Fever" -- (10:00) Loretta talks about being the first girl to do her own harmonies on her recordings -- (10:45) Loretta talks about the majority of her family recording music, including her son Ernest Ray -- (11:28) Loretta talks about her younger sister Crystal doing really well as a recording artist -- (11:53) Loretta talks about her upcoming television appearances and touring destinations -- (12:50) Loretta talks about touring with Ernest Tubb -- (13:03) Loretta talks about Ernest Tubb recording with a new label -- (13:25) Loretta talks about how rapidly the music business is changing, especially country -- (14:15) Loretta and Jack talk about Mel Tillis recording pop-country music -- (14:44) Loretta talks about refusing to record pop music, she says "you're looking at country" -- (15:27) Jack talks about promoters saying how much money they make when Conway and Loretta perform for them -- (15:40) Loretta talks about not understanding pop music -- (16:25) Loretta gives her opinion on why country music is so good -- radio commercial -- (18:25) Loretta talks about the last festival she performed at -- (19:00) Loretta talks about the festival being wild -- (19:30) Loretta talks about country shows being well attended across the nation -- (20:30) Loretta talks about her western wear stores -- (20:45) Loretta talks about her husband and his farming, and how he does not like to travel with her -- (21:05) Loretta talks about preferring to ride in her bus rather than fly -- (21:25) Loretta talks about traveling to Hollywood, and hating to fly -- (21:55) Loretta talks about her religious recordings -- (22:30) Loretta talks about how just about every one of her records going number one -- (23:15) Loretta talks about her most requested songs -- (23:48) Loretta talks about her country records doing better than most pop records -- (24:37) Loretta talks about performing for President Nixon and President Carter -- (25:33) Loretta talks about her biggest thrill being recording with Ernest Tubb -- (26:00) Loretta talks about wanting to, but never recording with her family members -- (26:52) Loretta talks about how good Crystals music career has been going -- (27:02) Loretta talks about back when she got her break in her career -- (28:11) Loretta talks about getting on with Decca and MCA -- (29:00) Loretta talks about her first few records -- (29:50) Loretta talks about having knives pulled on her by jealous women -- (30:15) Loretta talks about working clubs early on in her career -- (30:58) Loretta and Jack talk about ticket prices going up over time -- (32:25) Loretta and Jack talks about doing a split-record -- (33:20) Loretta talks about only being as good as your song -- (33:55) Ernest Ray talks about his new record -- (34:11) Loretta and Jack talk about new artists breaking into the industry -- (34:50) Ernest Ray talks about his siblings and traveling with Loretta -- (35:10) Ernest Ray talks about his second record release with MCA -- (35:48) Loretta talks about never changing her name -- (36:30) Ernest Ray talks about traveling with Loretta and hoping his record does well -- (37:00) Loretta talks about Owen Bradley always being her producer -- (37:50) Ernest Ray talks about Loretta's new recording -- (38:15) Loretta talks about some older songs that would be big if they were brought back -- [unidentifiable audio]
